metadata.title: Wednesday, 7th November, 2012
metadata.session: SECOND SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a)    what measures have been taken to upgrade the hospitality facilities in Livingstone to meet international standards in view of the co-hosting of the 2013 World Tourism Conference by Zambia and Zimbabwe; and
(b)    what economic benefits are expected from the Conference.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication what measures the Ministry has taken to compel operators of unlicensed taxis to be registered.
Minister of Tourism and Art when the Government will crop the wild animals, especially elephants, in Mulobezi Game Management Area to reduce on the increased human-animal conflict in the area.
questions.question_text: ORDER OF THE DAY 1    Estimates of Revenue and Expenditure (Including Capital and Constitutional and Statutory Expenditure):Committee of Supply: Resumption of Debate: (Head 06/01: under consideration): (Dr Chituwo). Heads 33/01, 33/02, 33/04, 33/05, 33/06, 07/01, 07/02, 07/03, 07/04, 07/05, 07/06, 07/07, 07/08, 07/09, 07/10, 07/13, 07/14, 07/15, 07/16, 07/17, 07/18, 07/19, 07/20, 07/21, 07/22, 45/01, 45/02, 45/03, 45/04, 45/05, 45/06, 45/07, 45/10, 45/11, 45/12, 45/13, 45/14, 45/15, 45/16, 45/17, 45/18 and 45/19 - for consideration. KEY TO HEADS OF EXPENDITURE Head 06    -    Public Service Commission – Office of the President Head 33    -    Ministry of Commerce, Trade and Industry Head 07    -    Office of the Auditor-General Head 45    -    Ministry of Community Development, Mother and Child Health
